hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: Hells Angels Member Says He'll Sue City

body.head.byline: By THOMAS J. LUECK; Compiled by John Sullivan

abstract.p: Hells Angels member Richard West plans lawsuit against New York City; claims police illegally took him into custody during search of motorcycle club's headquarters in New York City; his lawyer Ron Kuby says police used excessive force; police were searching for evidence in beating of woman outside club on Jan 28 (S)

block.p: Richard West, a member of the New York chapter of the Hells Angels, says he will file a lawsuit against the city, claiming that he was illegally taken into custody after a search of the motorcycle club's East Village headquarters at 77 East Third Street on Monday. Dozens of police officers, backed by sharpshooters, helicopters and heavy equipment, used a search warrant to seek evidence connected to the beating of a woman outside the building on Sunday night. Ronald L. Kuby, a lawyer for the Hells Angels, said the police used excessive force. The club had refused to allow several officers to enter the heavily fortified building, so the larger contingent arrived.
